articles.title: Continental Clash: The India–Asia Collision and the Rise of the Himalayas - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Compelling new evidence resolves discrepant interpretations and supports the large size of Greater India. Hundreds of millions of years ago, the surface of the Earth looked very different from how we see it today. There were just two continents: Laurasia and …
articles.content:
ByChina University of GeosciencesNovember 4, 2023
Recent research has revealed that Greater India, before its collision with Asia, was a single tectonic plate up to 3,000 kilometers wide, altering o… [+6027 chars]

articles.author: Robin Hicks
articles.title: Rabies is spreading in Southeast Asia, fuelled by inequality and neglect - Eco-Business
articles.description: Rabies is not considered to be a disease of economic importance, as it mainly affects people in marginalised communities. A study explores how the zoonotic disease has spread across Southeast Asia post-pandemic and how it can be eliminated.
articles.content: One of the world’s oldest diseases has been spreading across Southeast Asia, infecting poor communities and mainly children in remote parts of the region where it has not previously been considered t… [+12717 chars]
